Reviews.Title: Rx100 Bundle
Reviews.Author: S. James
Reviews.Content: This review and the associated 4 stars are for the Bundle not the Camera. If you have gotten to this bundle you have already decided on the RX100 and are just trying to get some additional value as I was. I will not speak to the quality of the Camera as that has been done much better than I could do.I managed to get the Camera today with the associated goodies.What you get for your $11 premium over the camera alone are:Spare battery -- not Sony brand it says it is 1600mah vs 1240mah for the stock Sony time will tell if that is accurateTripod --------- Zeikos brand its tiny-- pocket size-- it even has a clip for your pocket. Not complaints for what it is.Cleaning kit --- A small bottle of fluid, 5 q-tips, and a small microfiber snippit.Camera case ---- Vivitar brand Meh it will do nothing fancy better than letting it get banged against car keys in a purse.Card reader ---- Zeikos brand it will do the job and I suppose if you don't want to plug the camera into the computer its ok.LCD protector -- Zeikos brand a universal product you have to cut to fit, the cardboard squeege with it scratches it up:(32GB SDHC ------ Sony Brand item #SF-32NX this is what you are paying for. $23.20 with prime is the cheapest on Amazon.Sony SF32NX/TQ 32GB SDHC Class 10 Memory CardSo in summary in my opinion the only thing really worth the price in order of value are the Sony 32gb card-- that alone is a steal. The tripod is nice I can see it being useful and who doesn't like a spare battery even if it is cheap and craps out quickly it is basically free. The rest are junk and if I would have known the lcd screen protectors would scratch so easily I would have ordered a good one already cut to fit with the camera.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera
Reviews.Author: Suzanne M. Houck
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera recently before a trip to Europe and would highly recommend the RX 100. wow. It captured great video quality and very decent sound inside a 1000 year old dark cathedral, wonderful panoramic shots and the stills are also spectacular. Love that it fits in my pocket, metal body, and great lens. Best all around camera I've ever owned. Only thing that's missing is a bigger zoom but gosh, this little thing packs a lot of great features. Own a Sony Nex 5 with several lenses that I also like a lot but it's large for travel. Have also owned Nikon SLR and bought a Canon S100 that I returned because of bum picture quality.  A great little camera.

Reviews.Title: A gift that was strikingly successful
Reviews.Author: jeremy bodine "certified grump"
Reviews.Content: The purchase of this camera was as a gift for a close family member who had read the reviews and thought it the best value for a small, lightweight but high resolution camera suitable for travel. I reviewed both the camera specifications, the combination packages in which it was offered, and the prices, and my Amazon purchase was the least expensive, most all-encompassing solution, from the many vendors and packages I searched. The camera is just as featured, its 20.2 MP resolution exceptional, and its recipient delighted.  I am considering a purchase for myself.

Reviews.Title: Small camera - big sensor.
Reviews.Author: Richard L. Bjornseth "Dick Bjornseth"
Reviews.Content: I hate to admit this, but I now own 8 digital cameras (too many) ranging from an Altoids box sized Pentax to a Fuji X100, to two  Infrared-converted cameras, to full frame Canon Mark II 5D.  Was looking for that ideal combination of a pocketable camera with a decent-sized sensor and some zoom capabilities and the Sony RX100 is in a class by itself that fits the bill.  Have now used this camera for several months and am thrilled with the results.  The best things about this camera are it's unique combination of small size, large sensor, and top resolution.  No need to carry around a dslr on a daily basis in case I see something worth photographing - which is every day.  This guy fits easily in my pants pocket - not possible with the 4/3 cameras with their bigger lens. I have a 27 inch monitor and the images of the Sony appear to be the same resolution and quality as a dslr.A few other comments: 1. As others may have indicated, the only small flaw (if you even want to call it a flaw) is that the access door to the SD card and battery appears a little flimsy - but I've never had any trouble with it.2. Some sort of grip or texture on the front might be nice, but I've added a leather Gariz 1/2 case that provides a little better grip without adding much to the bulk.  Having compared and tested the Sony RX 100 to other compact-sized camera - including my slightly larger Olympus XZ-1 here are some final comments:  1. I find myself going to the Sony when I want especially high quality images. 2. I use the Olympus when I want easy access to special effects such as "dramatic tone" or "pop art" or "pin hole."  The higher price of the Sony RX 100 (over $600) is worth it to me - especially if I want enlargements beyond 13 x 19.  Otherwise the Olympus XZ-1 is a perfect lower- priced pocket camera with outstanding capabilities as well.

Reviews.Title: Best purchase I've made recently
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Boyle
Reviews.Content: I picked this up just prior to leaving on vacation to the Grand Canyon.  Learned its ins and outs on the plane...very user friendly...GREAT PICS!  My only issue is that because the on/off button and the shutter button are so close together, I would sometimes shut it off while trying to take a picture.  Once I realized what the issue was, I just paid more attention!  The compact size is great, but the results of the photos are AWESOME,!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Aline Tucker
Reviews.Content: Excellent pictures. Great choice of picture modes. My only complaint is the short telephoto for a camera of this price and the lack of a standard case.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, does just what I need
Reviews.Author: Deb in Western NC
Reviews.Content: I love my digital SLR, but it's so bulky that I end up leaving it at home.  I've had various digital point-and-shoots, and they are great for snapshots, but don't do exactly what I want, which is to be able to shoot in burst mode (to capture fast-moving animals), or in low-light situations.  I'm still learning what this camera can do (and it appears to do almost anything a photographer would want), but at first blush, it thoroughly meets my expectations (and then some).  One of the best things is its size...it's small enough and light enough to fit into my purse (or could be worn in a case on one's belt), so it will get used.  Very happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-RX100 bundle
Reviews.Author: mcat
Reviews.Content: Products arrived in short order and packaged well. Camera is everything it claims and more. I was searching for a quality camera in a small package and the RX100 is it. Bundle was worth the extra $$.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: bouga
Reviews.Content: The camera is awesome.  I would highly recommend getting the book Phtotographer's Guide to the Sony DSC-RX100 to make sure that you are understanding everything that this great little camera can do.  The camera takes excellent pictures - sharp and crisp.  It is exactly the camera I was looking for when I take trips - even day trips - when I do not want to lug along my DSLR.

Reviews.Title: An absolutely wonderful camera with SLR features.
Reviews.Author: Dorothy Herrmann
Reviews.Content: I wanted a compact camera with SLR features, and the Sony DSC-RX100 certainly fills the bill. Although I use mainly the Macro lens (for photographing small items that I sell on-line), I appreciate all the features and the fact that the camera automatically adjusts to different situations.  My only quibble is that this camera does not come with a battery recharger and the ones offered for purchase as substitutes do not work.  However, I have luckily found a source for inexpensive X batteries.  The ones offered by Sony are expensive, and believe me, this camera eats up batteries.  Also note: this camera gives no warning that the battery is low. It simply flashes "Battery Exhausted" and stops working, so I always carry a spare one.

Reviews.Title: New age in small cameras
Reviews.Author: Diane PF
Reviews.Content: This camera has all that the bigger,fancier cameras have. It has an easy Zoom, portrait, and panoramic features. The RX100 has built in tutorials. Which helps when learning all the new features. Give me a few months to judge if it is worth the cost; right now, I think it will prove very reasonable. D

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Myung Yu
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife for Christmas. I'm extremely impressed with the quality of the product as well as the result of the picture and video quality.Only con is the price but you get what you pay for.. Which is a great product

Reviews.Title: Sony rx100
Reviews.Author: Hossamoree
Reviews.Content: I bought this compact camera for my wife , she love it and i love it , it was best compact camera in 2012

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera.
Reviews.Author: Alejandro J Ceppi
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic, versatile and sturdy compact pocket size camera. The menus I believe are set in quite an intuitive way and give access to lots of shooting options and features and you can customize the function's menu to suit your preferences. The ring around the lens with which you can control the diaphragm aperture, the manual focusing or other functions which you can assign to it, feels great. It is also great that you can take pictures directly in Raw (for which you will need to use a program as could be Image Data Converter ver.4 that you can download freely form Sony`s web site, capable of correcting the strong optical distortions produced by the lens at some of the focal distances it covers and which the camera corrects automatically when shooting for jpg) and that the sensor, apart from being quite big considering this is a compact camera, covers a 12 EV dynamic range. Noise is not too visible in images nor bothers much below 1600 ISO, which is good enough. It has a pop-up springloaded flash which you can twist backwards to bounce the light on a ceiling when the camera is in a horizontal position or against a wall if it is in a vertical position, which is a nice detail. As with any camera without an optical viewfinder, with just an LCD screen, taking pictures under the sun can be tricky. Not a good camera for macros (most compact cameras with smaller sensors can do better in this respect) as it only focuses at short distances with the zoom at its widest angle. The same can be said for the maximum aperture, which closes rapidly as soon as you zoom-in just a bit, though it stays big enough anyway. In spite of some minor drawbacks, I would recommend this camera for anyone that can do with a 28 to 100 mm (35mm equivalent) focal length zoom and does not need the camera to shoot macro photos of flowers nor close-ups of birds, but want near DSLR quality images delivered by a pocket size camera.Regarding the bundle which is being offered by this seller, I would say it is worth paying for it. Except for the "deluxe case", which is not a great deal (the one I got is too big for just the camera), the rest of the accessories are fine and I think that having a spare battery is a must and if not as part of a bundle, you ought to buy one anyway.PS. (added): The lighting of the flash is quite weak (it has a very low guide number). It is of course strong enough so as to be able to trigger (using the camera in Manual mode) a photo cell from an independent speedlight which could be used nearby or beside the camera as slave to achieve more flash power.

Reviews.Title: Super camera!
Reviews.Author: DC
Reviews.Content: An incredibly versatile pocket sized camera. Very impressed with the numerous DSL-like features. I highly recommend purchasing "Photographer's Guide to the SONY DSC-RX100" by Alexander S. White in order to easily utilize the many features available on this camera. Only wish the telephoto had more capability. A pricey but Great camera!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera for someone who is not a professional, but maybe for them too.
Reviews.Author: BillN
Reviews.Content: I have owned many cameras over the past 50 years.  From range finders to SLRs to compacts to smartphones.  This camera truly hits the sweet spot.  The advantage to this camera is that it has the versatility of an SLR except for lens interchangeability and the size of a compact.  The resolution of the images is stunning and they can be cropped without losing much definition.  It has a fast lens and can shoot in very low light - perfect for indoor candid photos of children.  I don't use the zoom lens much indoors since the aperture drops off as you zoom in.  It is easier to simply crop the photo later and not sacrifice definition by increasing the ISO.  I have it set up so it is virtually silent.For those who want to be able to go full manual and set aperture as well as shutter speed and ISO this camera has it all.  Sony left very little out on that side things.  It also has HDR settings and exposure compensation.  The automatic focus is very fast, close to the speed of a DSLR.How could it be made better?  A lens that does not close down on the aperture throughout the zoom would be nice.  An articulating screen would be a plus as would built in wifi and gps.  Some of those things would probably add bulk, however.  One thing that should be added is a small grip to the right side of the camera.  Unfortunately, the camera is so sleek it feels as though it will easily slip out of your hand if you hold it one-handed.  I added an aftermarket grip for about $34.00 and it was worth every penny.This is not a cheap camera.  It is almost double what a "good" compact camera costs.  On the other hand, I have not found a truly pocketable camera that is remotely close to the images this camera can produce.  I was considering a DSLR, but when I thought about lugging a big camera with extra lenses around when I travel I thought I would try this.  I'm glad I did.  My wife liked it so much I had to get her one too.

Reviews.Title: Best Point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: J. Cheung
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the purchase.  Used the camera on my trip to Thailand last month and the portability and picture quality was amazing.  I typically use my Canon 40D, but this is a very good replacement when I don't want to carry a large camera.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Sony RX 100 seems to have a BATTERY/power PROBLEM
Reviews.Author: pegasus
Reviews.Content: I  used a BRAND NEW Sony RX 100 for 5 days , taking ca.280 photos after having the (original Sony NP-BX1)battery fully charged -- on day 4 (following an all night charge --the camera was resting on a table) after less than 5 exposures the camera signaled : BATTERY EXHAUSTED -- it took a long time (several hours)to recharge it -- I thereforeresearched this aspect ON-LINE, and surprise,surprise : PLENTY OF BATTERY or POWER FAILURE REPORTS -- so if you consider buying the RX 100 , do yourself a favor andlook into this potential problem -- (This never happened with the Canon PowerShot SD 960 IS over 4 years of use ) -- The RX 100 takes very good photos !!Other CONS : NO useful MANUAL - you have to buy one extra !! - The camera has NO separate charging device ( it is charged with the battery IN the camera & the cord is veryshort) - The EXPOSURE  BUTTON is very difficult (almost impossible) to feel  - same with the on/off button, and may require visual checking ( my Canon does NOT have this problem ! ) - the "miniature" zoom lever is difficult to locate and could easily be bigger and more convenient -- these aspects greatly take away from an easy & convenientuse !! ( and could easily be improved upon !! ) -- I therefore strongly consider returning the Sony RX 100 : What good is it if it is difficult to use and  may not workreliably !!

Reviews.Title: Camera and card work OK
Reviews.Author: Arthur Hampton "Aging gym rat"
Reviews.Content: but the rest is just junk. The spare battery lasted about two months. Yippee. But the little Sony camera is amazing. You'll need to read the instruction manual or a second party manual to discover the remarkable things this little beast can do. Pretty amazing.

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: Marie Panlener
Reviews.Content: this package is a good buy. I also bought an ebook for instruction that was helpful since this camera has lots of new features. I previously had a sony pocket sized camera so a lot of the buttons were familiar to me. I especially like the small devise to transfer photos to your computer,

Reviews.Title: Jewel of a camera
Reviews.Author: William T. Debnam
Reviews.Content: This is a compact camera, deluxe. The only accessory recommended is the SONY leather case. It takes wonderful digital photos.I have only just scratched the surface with it. This is a fine machine, and ultra portable. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: Spectacular camera
Reviews.Author: Peter Sprague
Reviews.Content: I was once a professional photographer for UPI in Moscow etcI wanted a high end point and shoot. The Sony is simply the best and most flexible camera I have ever owned. The auto settings are amazingWhen they add wi fi capability I will buy my next camera and perhaps my last

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera kit
Reviews.Author: Irish Lust
Reviews.Content: I'm a novice photographer and so far I've only used the camera's auto focus, but I've been very pleased with the pictures taken. The camera itself is pretty intuitive which is great but if you want in depth info unfortunately you have to go online to Sony support.  The camera allows you to take pictures in JPEG, RAW or Both its easy to switch settings.  Allowing the camera to choose the proper setting to take pictures in auto focus has been precise, so for beginners this is a terrific camera that you'll never outgrow.  Editting/Cropping pictures really brings a lot of detail out in the pictures.  Used the camera to take pictures of a winter storm down on the water and didn't  use a tripod it caught the mist and droplets as if I had used a tripod.  I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone looking for a small point & shoot camera that fits in your pocket.  I Love this Camera!

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera
Reviews.Author: hollijs01
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It was suggested to me by a co-worker with a lot of photography experience. The images are sharp and when I take pictures during sports and they don't blur. I have pictures of the kids diving in mid air and no blur at all. I wanted to be able to capture pictures during hikes along with taking pictures of the family and it has been great for both. The only problem is that the zoom isn't quite strong enough, but it has everything else. There are way too many options for a beginner like me, but I'll figure them out in time. Not sure why they didn't put a user manual on CD and stick it in the box, it would have been very helpful. I love using the scene select for sports and macro shots they always come out great. The camera is quite small and I am a woman with avg hands. I do find myself fumbling with it sometimes, but considering I bought it to hike with it's perfect.As long as you aren't looking to take shots that you need a great deal of zoom, you'll love this camera.

Reviews.Title: DLSR quality in a small package
Reviews.Author: Rexspook
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is fantastic and has a ton of shooting options. small enough to carry around in your pocket so you will use it more than a big heavy DLSR. Only problen is it does not have a strong zoom.

Reviews.Title: Third one I have purchased
Reviews.Author: G. E. Gonderinger "Gondo"
Reviews.Content: I got one for myself and then for my sister who is a professional photographer who could not stop raving about its sharp pictures and flexibility. I then got one for the other sister who is a part time photographer. I am now a very popular brother. Thank goodness I don't come from a large family! This camera is great. I love it for stop action sport shots. The school yearbook is using a lot of my pictures! I just returned from a trip to Europe and this camera is perfect in darkened churches etc.i got some great mountain panorama pics as well! I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great compact
Reviews.Author: Simon
Reviews.Content: It's a great compact camera.  The pictures are way better than previous point and shoots i've owned.  I bought it mainly because i was looking for great imaging in a small package, and this model has delivered.  i wish the macro performance was better, but it's not horrible...and maybe you can't have everything.  great zoom would be nice too, but like many people out there have mentioned, the fidelity is so high that you can probably just crop/zoom for closer pics (kind of like a digital zoom).batter life seems pretty good.  fit and finish is nice, and it has a nice heft to it.Overall, pretty satisfied with this one!

Reviews.Title: The Perfect Travel Camera
Reviews.Author: Donald York
Reviews.Content: A fantastic small, pocket-sized camera with big format (20megpixels). This camera continues to work flawlessly, taking great images every time. It goes with me everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Many features and better than the canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: CanonGirl
Reviews.Content: not much more to say except this rating system of mandatory word count is ridiculous and makes a purchaser not want to leave reviews

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera; poor quality items in the package that came with it
Reviews.Author: James Waugh
Reviews.Content: The Sony camera is an excellent product and I am delighted to have it.  The "package" put together by the seller, apart from the spare battery and flash card, was of low quality and I could have easily done without it.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect bundle
Reviews.Author: D. Matheny
Reviews.Content: I won't go into details about the camera - other than to say everybody else is right.  It really is a fantastic compact camera!Once I decided on this camera, I did a little price shopping and found that it's priced pretty much the same everywhere.  The only difference is that there are a couple of bundles available that sell for the same price as the bare camera - which makes this a no-brainer.For me, this particular bundle is almost perfect.  If I could make one change, I would keep these items: spare battery, 32GB SD card, SD reader, and possibly the case.  The other accessories are throw-away items as far as I'm concerned, so I would swap them for a plug-in charger like this one.That missing wall charger has got to be the biggest oversight with the DSC-RX100 camera, and I would highly recommend picking one up along with this bundle.Overall, I think this is the best compact camera on the market and I would highly recommend it!  I would also recommend picking it up as part of this bundle along with a wall plug charger.

Reviews.Title: Great small camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel Hoefflin "DRH"
Reviews.Content: Quite impressive for such a small camera.  It has large-sized quality and capabilities in a small-sized unit.  It's a bit pricey, but the quality and features are remembered more than the cost.

Reviews.Title: This camera is an excellent point & shoot model
Reviews.Author: Bernie
Reviews.Content: Needing a small camera for family events and other times when I didn't want to lug around my heavy DSLR with all the accessories. It performs well, images are sharp and generally true to color, no shutter lag.

Reviews.Title: Super Sharp Photos
Reviews.Author: CHARLES LOSCH
Reviews.Content: The image quality is remarkable.  I own a Rebel XT and a Nikon S8100 and neither one takes as sharp of a photo as the Sony.  My Canon is too big to bring to family events and the Nikon started making clicking noises as if it can't find it's focus point.  Stops if I put it on fixed focus.  Very annoying in video. Been repaired once under warranty.  Canon takes great photos, but I wanted something the size of the Nikon I could keep in my pants pocket.  This fit the bill.Still are so sharp and lifelike.  The scene selector wheel give a brief overview of what the setting does.  Nice feature to help learn all the functions.  I still have not learned all the features and I sometimes get oddities;  taking a photo of my daughter it took what I had in the viewer and also a close up of her face.  Don't know why, doe this only if I am close to my subject, so it might be a portrait feature.  With some settings the camera takes a few seconds to "Process" the photos, which slows down the action if you are trying to take several photos in a close succession.  Might be my fault since I'm still figuring out how it all works.Videos with the Sony are sharp, but when I put it on the video selection, they are too dark.  Video works best under normal settings.  Again, very sharp video with great sound pick up.Well worth the price.  Great deal from Beach Camera with the included items.  The extra battery is great and the 32Gb card fills fast.  You might want to order a second

Reviews.Title: This camera is amazing!
Reviews.Author: Eldon C. "E.D. Christians"
Reviews.Content: It is very difficult to find a small camera that takes pictures with such quality.  The only downside is the price.

Reviews.Title: A Great Package with Over a Hundred Dollars in Extra Accesories, Many Quite Essential!
Reviews.Author: Klynn Hisatake
Reviews.Content: I cant say much about the camera that hasnt already been said. Its an incredible piece of photography equipment. Incredibly compact and well designed for its abilities and can take a hell of a picture in a variety of conditions and with all manner of modes, filters, and what have you.That said the extras are mostly well worth it and make for some great value, most notably the extra battery and 32 Gig memory card. These are things I would have bought anyways and they come free in this package as well as several other helpful accessories

Reviews.Title: LOVE!
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I adore this camera. After extensive research online to find a camera that would meet my needs, I settled on the RX100 and then went about picking where to buy it. I decided on this seller because of the enticing package deal. It came promptly, everything was in perfect condition, and I could not be happier.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera for the price
Reviews.Author: SanguineDream
Reviews.Content: This camera takes professional quality pictures and video with a decent mic to boot! I would recommend this to the everyday picture enthusiast as well as well seasoned photography masters. Great, quick, light and durable point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera and Pretty Darn Good Accessories
Reviews.Author: G. Halcomb
Reviews.Content: The camera is a real jewel and there are plenty of technical reviews you can read on line.  I'll focus mainly on the extras with this package from Beach Camera.First, the camera.  Because of the 20MP sensor and fast 1.8 Zeiss lens pictures are beautiful with plenty of control over depth of field.  Yes, the flash is located in a bad spot, the user manual sucks, and the menu system is somewhat confusing.  Once you buy the highly rated book by White and get used to the flash location you'll be very happy.  BTW, this an official US camera/warranty, not a Far East model.When I purchased this package, it was the same price as the camera alone, so what is there to lose?  The 32GB SD Card was a Sony Class 10, perfect.  The extra battery was a Vivitar, which works as well as the original Sony, perfect.  The case is not bad - good size for the camera, but no pockets and a cheap strap.  The SD card to USB adapter is a Vivitar - if you need it I'm sure it works fine.  Ditto the little tri-leg stand.  Only complaint is the screen protector - worthless!  You must cut to size and it peels off immediately.All-in-all a very nice addition to a great camera.

Reviews.Title: very nice product.
Reviews.Author: Xiaming L.
Reviews.Content: It is so light and so powerful, if you need a very light camera with high quality performance, I strongly recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: What a GREAT camera and kit
Reviews.Author: Dennis Bennett
Reviews.Content: I've had a few different pocket cameras, which were good for snap shots, but with no manual controls, often times I couldn't capture an image the way I wanted to. The reason I sometimes carried a pocket camera is because I didn't want to carry a full size DSLR due to weight and bulk (for example - when hunting or fishing in the mountains).The Sony RX100 reminds me of the old Leica rangefinders with all of the manual controls, but much, much more capability. It's GREAT in low light, and the image quality allows me to make beautiful enlarged metal prints. This camera is Exactly what I needed.The instruction manual is pretty vague, but I found an excellent manual online that provides detailed information for all of the settings and controls.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: don nguyen
Reviews.Content: Awesome quality.  Compact design with DSLR quality is essential.  Carry everywhere and all events and get quality pics. So many features to use.  I use it as a simple point and shoot and picture quality is still amazing.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and the bonus package
Reviews.Author: TOBG
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera you can use it either as a point and shoot or you can use the individual settings. The bonus material was a good addition for the price. The HD card alone is worth the price. I have also used the camera case and it works. The Tripod at 4 inches is not worth much. The extra battery I have not tried. Some have found it fails fairly soon after. The card reader is also not worth much since you can just plug in the camera via USB to your computer. The screen cleaner should be useful. I have not tried it yet.

Reviews.Title: great camera but price ..
Reviews.Author: yahya
Reviews.Content: great one I love it .. but so expensivehigh resulition .. great by sony ..come SD card worth pruce for package

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-RX100
Reviews.Author: Jan Marie Jackman
Reviews.Content: The camera is simple to use for the novice and takes great pictures with the automated presets.  There are also great third party reviews and evaluations on YouTube which is a quick way to learn the features of the camera and how to use.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Adam T. Pecher "ValpoHome"
Reviews.Content: Good camera and good package of stuff to go with it. High quality photos appreciated with a handy USB data drop.

Reviews.Title: The best point and shoot on the market/only maybe
Reviews.Author: J. Capobianco
Reviews.Content: I finally decided to sell some lenses that were no longer being used and picked up the RX100 bundle (my camera was made in Japan).Despite a flimsy battery latch it is a very well made camera that can do everything. I'm not a videoguy I am a shooter so this review is based on what a camera is SUPPOSED to do, that is provide sharp images.I tested it against 2 premium cameras; my EOS 5D (original 12mp)with an EF 28-105mm and my Panasonic dmc-LX1 (the best point and shoot of 2005)the same scene was shot at 28 and 100mm with the same f stops at iso 100.The result;The 5D combo with the 28-105 was last, perhaps a 24-70L would have fared better since there was a bit more color represented in the scene.The rx100 was second place-YES SECOND. The image was the largest, but the lens sharpness, color and contrast was not up to the Lens on the LX1. The right side and the upper left corner were slightly less sharp than the center.The LX1's Leica simply is the sharpest lens to the edges and has the most striking contrast and colors (I paid $39 on Ebay for it!!). I'm sure at iso200 and up it would be last due to grain and its old processor, but this result is making me think that the LX7 may be the sharper shooter than the RX100, I have already seen some sample tests online that show it has a more uniform image.Do your homework and compare them before buying.

Reviews.Title: Great small camera
Reviews.Author: Ramos Apulan
Reviews.Content: I've only used this camera for a week now and I can say that this is a great small camera. Pictures quality is awesome. Need to learn more though to take better photos quality. I bought the guide book, Photographer's Guide to the Sony DSC-RX100, before I bought the camera to have better idea about this camera. I checked others pictures taken by the camera on flickr, and I made up my mind to get this camera for my next vacation, really small, light but great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Sony SDC-RX100 Package Deal at Sunset Electronics
Reviews.Author: Robert Isbell
Reviews.Content: I'm and more than pleased with the Sony DSC-RX100 camera.  It takes fantastic pictures, i.e., very close to DSLR quality.  I'm also very pleased with the quick delivery I received from Sunset Electronics.  I received the camera two days earlier than the earliest estimated date and will not hesitate from ordering from Sunset Electronics again.  Also, the package deal from Sunset Electronics was extremely good (32 GB card, camera case, extra battery, tripod, card reader, and more) and it cost less than just the camera alone at other locations.

Reviews.Title: So happy
Reviews.Author: GregRN "GregRN"
Reviews.Content: This (rather expensive) camera is really worth the money.  It takes fantastic pictures and the battery life is much longer than my Sony dsc-hx5v.  I love how it automatically de-focuses the background while I take close-up shots of my kids.  Highly recommended if you have the cash to spend on it.Also, the bundle is a real good deal mostly because of the Sony SD card.  The tripod will get some use, and I haven't had to use my spare battery yet (but it's nice to have).

Reviews.Title: Really a great camera
Reviews.Author: Siggy Stardust
Reviews.Content: You can feel the quality level immediately. It takes great looking snapshots on Auto mode, and then you can go from there.

Reviews.Title: Best compact camera. ever.
Reviews.Author: Lawrence E. Butler
Reviews.Content: Wonderful in low light. Smart settings make taking complex photos easier.  The fold back pop up flash is perfect for bouncing the flash in close up settings.  Love this camera.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Domingos Escova
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is up to my expectations.Ive not been using al the features buy im already amazed by what i can do with it.Just love it.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've had so far
Reviews.Author: Elle Ena
Reviews.Content: Take amazing quality photos with lots of different settings to choose from. Great camera for an amateur like me who wanted better looking photos without having to upgrade to a DSLR (both for cost and size reasons). On top of it, this bundle is a great deal!

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: Rupert
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty easy to use and has automated settings to take any guesswork out of its use.  Very clear, high resolution pictures.  Recommend this for anyone who is not looking to work much at getting a good shot.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Bridgetut
Reviews.Content: I am still learning how to use this camera but it takes amazing pictures, has endless settings, and is easy to use even for an amateur with its Intelligent Settings.  The bundle is well worth it, i am using everything it came with.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera Love it!
Reviews.Author: Hemal Basra
Reviews.Content: Takes a little time to understand all the functions. Be sure to download the long manual from sony's support website. Once you set the

Reviews.Title: Great Camera worth every penny!
Reviews.Author: sanjana
Reviews.Content: Great camera great night shots. I have a Nikon D 300 but I have always wanted something light and easy to carry this is just perfect for day to day use. Very good quality pictures. Sony has really out done itself on this. I have never been this happy about a camera

Reviews.Title: Received Today- Unsealed Box
Reviews.Author: J. Robinson
Reviews.Content: The box arrived and was unsealed. Makes me very nervous that the camera is refurbished. I am going to return it and ask for a sealed box.

Reviews.Title: As good as advertised
Reviews.Author: Duffer "Lovestheoutdoors"
Reviews.Content: Not much to add, phenomenal quality in point and shoot body.  Expensive and worth it.Pros: size , photo qualitycons: noneRemember, it is not an SLR but it is the finest point and shoot in the world.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing.
Reviews.Author: NOYB
Reviews.Content: Based on the rave reviews, I purchased this item.  It was a splurge given the promised picture quality and size/convenience.  I was looking forward to trying the various settings and controlling my photos.  Sadly, I have had very bad luck getting any pictures that are even decent.  The user interface is complicated -- really unnecessarily so,  I could maybe overlook that, given the convenient size -- which was perfect.  But for all the effort to get the settings just right, the pictures do not live up to the promise.  And for a quick picture, all of the automatic settings take surprisingly lousy pictures.  I paid a premium with the idea that I would get fantastic quality pictures.  For most of my pictures, I would have been better off with my iPhone for convenience, or lugging my much larger Nikon SLR, which does take really beautiful photos.  This item will be returned.  :-(

ProductInfo.Name: Sony DSC-RX100 20.2 MP Exmor CMOS Sensor Digital Camera with 3.6x Zoom BUNDLE with Sony 32GB High Speed Class 10 SD Card, Spare Battery, Deluxe Case, Card Reader, Mini Tripod, LCD Screen protectors and MORE!
